text:
Here are some of the most outrageous menu items offered throughout Taco Bell's history.

You could easily make an entire new verse or two of Billy Joel 's " We Didn’t Start the Fire " rattling off the colorful concoctions Taco Bell has unveiled since it introduced the Doritos Locos Tacos in 2012, per the restaurant's official site . If you're someone who eats with your eyes, how about some pictures instead to satiate your visual appetite and Live Más?

Over the years, the chain has updated its original menu with specialty items for a limited time: Some of its offerings include nacho fries , naked chicken chips, tacos and chalupas with a chicken shell (or an egg or biscuit), burritos stuffed with fries (or Cheetos), Pop Rocks-esque flavor crystals made out of cayenne, mystery slushie flavors and breakfast items for $1.

Gone are the days when the Taco Bell menu was simply variations on a hard taco, soft taco, nachos and cinnamon twists.

01 of 22 Nacho Boxes Taco Bell The fast-food chain is stepping up their nacho game. Two nacho boxes are being tested at the Manhattan Cantina restaurant: the Chicken Enchilada Nachos Box and the Steak and Cheddar Nachos Box. They're also testing a Buffalo Chicken Nachos Box in Charlotte, North Carolina and the Cheesy Jalapeño Nachos Box in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. If enough people are into the $5 boxes, they could expand to locations nationwide.

02 of 22 Rattlesnake and Reaper Fries Taco Bell After the smashing success of their nacho fries, the chain is testing out two new varieties at certain locations in Ohio. The Rattlesnake Fries are made with grilled steak, jalapeño sauce and nacho cheese, while the Reaper Fries are served with ranch dressing infused with Carolina Reapers — the world's hottest chile pepper.

03 of 22 French Toast Chalupa Dayton, Ohio, residents are in for a breakfast treat. Taco Bell announced in April that they are testing a new chalupa made with a French toast shell at locations in the Midwest city. The sweet new addition to the menu, which sells for $2.49, also features scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage crumbles with syrup on the side.

04 of 22 $1 Triple Melt Burrito and Nachos Taco Bell wants you to get a whole lot more bang for your buck by introducing the $1 triple melt burrito and $1 triple melt nachos. Both new items, available nationwide starting April 5, are made up of seasoned beef, shredded three-cheese blend and nacho cheese. The chain is also bringing back the beefy crunch burrito for $1 in Chattanooga, Tenn., locations as part of a test, as well as the $1 crispy chicken taco being tested in Oklahoma City restaurants before possibly going nationwide in 2019.

05 of 22 Tortilla Chips Taco Bell Starting in May, Taco Bell will be stocking grocery store shelves with tortilla chips inspired by the flavors of their iconic sauces. Available in Classic, Mild and Fire, the bags will be easily recognizable to fans of the fast food chain because the design is nearly identical to the sauce packets (and, yes, still include little words of wisdom).

06 of 22 Nacho Fries After being tested in West Virginia and California locations last spring, the fast food chain is finally adding fries to its nationwide menu on Jan. 24. The crispy new additions will be covered in "bold Mexican seasoning" and served with a side of nacho cheese for dipping, according to a press release. The standard size will cost only $1, but hungry fans can upgrade to the Supreme for $2.49 or Bell Grande for $3.49, which comes topped with beef, pico de gallo, sour cream and more nacho cheese.

07 of 22 California Loaded Fries Burrito Taco Bell The Mexican-style fast-food chain is making a French fry-filled burrito that could thrill or horrify West Coast natives. The new menu item, per Food Beast, originated in San Diego and comes packed with beef, nacho cheese, guacamole, sour cream and plenty of crispy fries. Not everyone will get a taste of it just yet, though — the burrito is only available in one lucky location in Charleston, W.Va., where it's being tested.

08 of 22 Kit Kat Chocoladilla Taco Bell Taco Bell is diving into dessert territory and teamed up with Kit Kat to create the ultimate "fourth meal." For $1, customers in Milwaukee can enjoy a grilled flour tortilla stuffed with Kit Kat bars. There are reports a Twix version also exists.

09 of 22 Forbidden Bowl and Burrito From now until Sept. 21, customers dining at Taco Bell's Orange County location can try their newest creations: the Forbidden Bowl and Forbidden Burrito. Both items include "forbidden" black rice, crispy avocados and a new sauce, topped with your favorite protein and fresh veggies. The price for each varies between $3.49 and $3.99 depending on choice of protein, or you can go all out and get it as part of the $5 box deal, which also includes a Doritos Locos Taco, a Crunchy Taco and a medium drink.

10 of 22 Naked Egg Taco Following the success of the Naked Chicken Chalupa, Taco Bell has added another "naked" item to their breakfast menu nationwide starting August 31. For $1.99, customers get potato bites, cheese, and bacon or sausage, all wrapped in a fried egg "shell."

11 of 22 Firecracker Burrito Perhaps the most bizarre item to hit the Taco Bell menu thus far, this burrito, according to Food Beast, features the usual rice, beef and cheese and red tortilla strips wrapped in a red tortilla — but it also comes with the option of adding cayenne "popping crystals" for an extra 20 cents. The sensation is similar to the popular Pop Rocks candy, causing a fizzy feeling in your mouth. Order it cheesy or spicy (loaded with chipotle sauce). For now, the rock candy is only available at four Taco Bell stores while in testing.

12 of 22 Beefy Potato-Rito Taco Bell Because potatoes add joy to everything, Taco Bell stuffed them into a burrito for only $1. For a limited time, customers can indulge in the Beefy Potato-Rito, which features a flour tortilla filled with seasoned beef, nacho cheese, its famous potatoes and chipotle sauce.

13 of 22 Double Chalupa Taco Bell Why have a regular Chalupa when you can have something even bigger? Taco Bell answered this question with its Double Chalupa, a wide shell stuffed with — you guessed it — twice the amount of beef, lettuce, sour cream, cheese and tomatoes. The mouthful of a creation will be available to customers through the end of July.

14 of 22 Naked Chicken Chips After the short-lived Naked Chicken Chalupa made waves across the nation, the chain introduced an innovation in fried poultry on May 2. This time, the triangular-shaped "chips" are made entirely of crispy chicken — perfect for dipping in their signature nacho cheese sauce.

15 of 22 Naked Chicken Chalupa Taco Bell Following its testing in select locations for months, the first taco shell to be made entirely of fried chicken is finally available nationwide, starting Jan. 26 for $2.99. The "un-shelled" menu item was hit among PEOPLE staffers: "I will eat one every day of my life going forward," said one happy tester.

16 of 22 Airheads White Mystery Freeze Taco Bell revitalized every '90s kids' favorite mystery by turning the white Airhead flavor into a sugary drink in September 2018. Customers can sip on a 16 oz. slushie for $1.99 until they've either guessed the flavor or suffered a serious brain freeze — whichever comes first.

17 of 22 Cheetos Burrito Starting in August, the chain began testing the Cheetos Burrito, which is exactly what it sounds like: a burrito with literal Cheetos stuffed inside it. For only $1, we can't see why this glorious creation won't make it into stores nationwide in no time.

18 of 22 $1 Breakfast Taco Bell After its release in March, PEOPLE staffers declared the insanely cheap breakfast menu as "one of the best things that happened to us this year, maybe ever." The deal includes eight items like the sausage flatbread quesadilla, mini skillet bowl, breakfast soft taco and hash browns.

19 of 22 Quesalupa Taco Bell The mashup, which joined the menu in February 2018, is made of a chalupa and a quesadilla, featuring all the classic chalupa fixings of beef, lettuce, tomato, sour cream, and cheddar cheese — with the bonus of having a shell stuffed with melted pepper jack cheese.

20 of 22 Chicken Biscuit Taco Taco Bell/AP This short-lived taco-shaped biscuit allowed customers to fill it with four different breakfast foods — sausage, egg and cheese; bacon, egg and cheese; crispy tortilla chip-breaded chicken with country gravy; or crispy chicken with jalapeño honey.

21 of 22 Waffle Taco Courtesy Taco Bell Ahead of the aforementioned biscuit taco came this sweet and savory breakfast combo made of a round, fried waffle wrapped around a sausage patty or bacon, with scrambled eggs, cheese and syrup on the side.

title: Taco Bell's Craziest Menu Items: Naked Chicken Chalupa and More
